meanings.definition: To talk continuously in a loud, annoying way.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah yammers on and on about her vacation.
meanings.sent2: The children yammers excitedly about their favorite cartoon characters.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa always yammers about the 'good old days' when he was young.
meanings.sent4: The engine yammers loudly, indicating a problem with the car.
meanings.sent5: The teacher yammers instructions to the students before the test.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, repetitive noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm yammers outside, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent2: The old clock yammers every hour, reminding us of the time.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door yammers annoyingly whenever someone opens it.
meanings.sent4: The machine yammers rhythmically as it completes its task.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks yammers in the distance, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.sent1: Ignore his yammers; he's just trying to confuse you.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's yammers had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The politician's yammers left everyone puzzled about his actual plans.
meanings.sent4: She dismissed his yammers as mere ramblings without any substance.
meanings.sent5: The book was full of yammers that made no sense, yet were entertaining.
